p: Based on the differential morphological characteristics, the genus Lippia was classified in seven sections [ 14]. The Zapania Schauer section is the most complex and exhibits inflorescences with flat bracts, spirally arranged, globose or hemispheric type, capituliform, with varying numbers of chromosomes (2n = 10–28). L. alba (Mill.) N.E.Br., L. aristata Schauer, L. brasiliensis (Link) T.R.S. Silva, L. corymbosa Cham., L. diamantinensis Glaz., L. duartei Moldenke, L. filifolia Mart. & Schauer, L. hermannioides Cham., L. lacunosa Mart. & Schauer, L. rotundifolia Cham. and L. rubella (Moldenke) T.R.S. Silva & Salimena [ 15, 16] are among the representatives of this section in the Brazilian flora.
